tweets.text: @davemh72 @LoneRanger77777 @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @DefraGovUK @Ofwat @EnvAgency So, what a nasty cocktail of pollution in the air to breathe in: noxious gas, landfill dust, leachate, surface odour and chemical odour-masking spray! And public health and environment agencies do nothing?! Disgraceful neglect of people's health! @BorisJohnson  @MattHancock
@davemh72 @LoneRanger77777 @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @DefraGovUK @Ofwat @EnvAgency I know, that's what I mean Dave - dangerous stuff 👎
Our Windrush neighbour the River Coln is dying and the @EnvAgency just lets it happen. Sound familiar? @Feargal_Sharkey @tomheapmedia https://t.co/j5b4e08b6g
Well you say legally but did the @EnvAgency ever disclose what the liquid was spilling into the landfill? @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe #stopthestink https://t.co/IC24TdPm7a
@DeniseO97662017 @LoneRanger77777 @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @DefraGovUK @Ofwat @EnvAgency It could be anything , not necessarily normal dust .
@WindrushWasp @EnvAgency @Feargal_Sharkey @tomheapmedia Whixh stretch of the Coln is this?

@davemh72 @LoneRanger77777 @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @DefraGovUK @Ofwat @EnvAgency You can actually see the dust rising in this photo. This is bound to be full of unhealthy particles being inhaled by people. Horrible 👎
@LoneRanger77777 @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @DefraGovUK @Ofwat @EnvAgency and https://t.co/m8x4NQmbct

domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

domain.name: TV Episodes
domain.description: Television show episodes

entity.name: White Peak
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

tweets.text: @joe_crowley @RosieP4 @BBCCountryfile @EnvAgency It's not just human excrement, condoms and wipes, by the way. It's farm runoffs that include pesticides, nitrogen fertilisers. Stuff that's difficult to trace back to source. Rivers are something we should proudly protect, but we're descending into making them sewers instead.
@Markmalkin15 @tayz_BETH @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink Rename the EA the Sweet FA
@LucyABeaumont @EnvAgencyNW Mam I’m here! We love you Lucy ❤️ thanks from all the Mums in our community. We just want our children to be safe. #stopthestink @Cap_it_off

@tayz_BETH @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink This morning is toxic the EA don't give a shit and the only action is to talk more and debate ho and put some extra monitoring stations up for data.  Correct me if I'm wrong thousands of newcastle residents telling them they are polluting the air we breathe isn't good enough?
@tayz_BETH @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink Could smell it in Talje Pits and Kidsgrove last week, it's becoming a regular event 🤢

tweets.text: @joe_crowley @RosieP4 @BBCCountryfile Enforcement, enforcement, and enforcement again. We should be asking questions about the @EnvAgency's funding cuts over a number of years and their lack of staff resources. What these companies are doing is often illegal - as a recent BBC documentary found. Shit in rivers... Yuk.

tweets.text: Tonight on @BBCCountryfile I'm taking a trip along the Wye in England and Wales, hearing about the river’s polluted waters & some of the reasons why it’s in a bad way. What’s the solution… a freeze on new homes? Farming restrictions? There's little consensus on the way forward!

@LucyABeaumont @EnvAgencyNW Thank you highlighting this environmental catastrophe. We are suffering so much here and it’s mind boggling how @EnvAgencyMids is allowing it to continue!#stopthestink https://t.co/wNmFhnyIso
@Gwynthegriff @ChrisGPackham @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest @WiseBirding I am not the only one to note the link.

Flood risk is a big concern for #LeaBridge. @wfcouncil plans to build over 3 green spaces around LB station heighten the risk & likelihood of major river flooding is part of climate changes that we need to be protected from. https://t.co/AkYSnHrhwH

More agricultural muck stored against the rules, literally on top of a watercourse this time. Directly under the muck pile runs a drainage ditch that runs straight into the River Frome, which runs straight into the Lugg, which exceeds phosphate limits. @EnvAgency /1 https://t.co/IhAXZqe2gs

Update from the ongoing incident @shropsfire at Greenway Polymers. #ThankYou for your continued support. @TelfordWrekin @EnvAgency @StaffsFire for Waste fire TacAd support, @HWFire for the drone @HighwaysWMIDS & not forgetting our own amazing staff from right across the service https://t.co/8fWixKgxuf

tweets.text:
Dereliction of @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland duty allowing a whole community to be plagued by landfill fumes.
Will you give us back our human rights @MPGeorgeEustice @MattHancock @DefraGovUK ? #stopthestink @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe https://t.co/PdnJfeAUC2

At this point when the @EnvAgency have clearly said they have no money to fix the out of control landfill to me it becomes the governments responsibility to step in. @AaronBell4NUL is taking it to Parliament again next week.Surely there will be clear actions/timelines from that? https://t.co/HuvlrNDGHl

See that light bit in the middle? It's a #fishing pond! We're just back from patrolling it with our @EnvAgencySE partners, for reports of illegal fishing & hooks on lines laid across. Nothing found today (except a downpour!) but we'll each check another time...or 2, or 3.  #27123 https://t.co/8IKu2joaRC
@JudyBrownsword @HelenVi00175623 @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink @JudyBrownsword ferl free to keep and use them.

It's absolutely vital  ban is legally watertight & that all breaches are rapidly prosecuted.  It requires properly functioning legal team in @EnvAgency.  We don't have that now (e.g. turning blind eye to flagrant water pollution offences). https://t.co/jvIkSGi8dR

tweets.text: @DefraUKAir @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @ClareDinnisEA @StinkStopthe unfortunately forecast to to be high as usual in Newcastle Under Lyme thanks to #walleysquarry @redindustries. No chance of us having our windows open for some fresh air @BorisJohnson 😢 https://t.co/WJjDPWNJo3

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/neO7mzoVRf

THREAD: A few more thoughts about this v welcome announcement from @DefraGovUK 

I know many of you are thinking "Why the need for a consultation?" and I COMPLETELY understand the frustration, of course!

But, it is probably necessary to ensure a ban is legally watertight https://t.co/l7m6wkzJ9r

It’s time for a public apology from @EnvAgencyMids surely @SimonTagg and @AaronBell4NUL . I won’t hold my breath but this is what residents have been saying for months, years and have been completely gaslit! https://t.co/GmUd1ugEvB

@ken_colwell For me the law is clear. Water companies should not be dumping sewage into our rivers at all "Save for exceptional circumstances".

That 20% reduction mentioned in that article would still mean discharges are illegal. Question is why are @DefraGovUK and @EnvAgency allowing it?

@ManOfKent15 @nidhug2009 @Jamie_Woodward_ @EnvAgency Wet wipes are not the source. Do they play a part, yes is, a minor one. The real source? Massive underinvestment in infrastructure.

In short water companies have paid out almost £60 billion in dividends to shareholders while filling our river full of sh*t.

@LucyABeaumont @EnvAgencyNW Easy fix stop pointless purchases which are landfilled, fumes come from compostable material. I  worked in a landfill there are strict controls in place they can generate massive energy back to the grid  check the farmers aren’t spreading on the fields easy to blame the landfill.
To have so many alerts mid May is ridiculous https://t.co/2SAjyj4qey

urls.title: Bathing water quality
urls.description: Search designated bathing waters by name, local authority or postcode

tweets.text:
Heading to the beach today?  The bathing water season has started -  before heading out, you can check how clean the water is at your local beach or further afield. 
Check the water quality of your local beach: https://t.co/vjFBpfnYmg https://t.co/I90ydzQGGX
